page.title: 09Gaddesden Row: Changes
page.content: Most people work outside Gaddesden Row. Of 20 families at school, 8 work with vehicles, 1 teaching, 2 building, 1 electronics, 5 agriculture, 3 computers.{Cottages}have been knocked together and houses are now expensive. The{Council houses}at Jockey's End are being sold to the people in them. About twelve new houses are to be built. Fewer people live in rented houses. A{community shop}is opening in the Village hall to replace the old Post Office and shop which closed years ago. More planes fly overhead as {Luton airport}expands. There are fewer farm workers needed. There are no longer any sheep, pigs, or poultry on Halsey estate. The fields grow mainly winter wheat and brilliant yellow rape. There are many babies in the Parish and the{school numbers}will stay at 30, or increase.
